title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India, tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, eating places, pictures, experiences etc.

**Food and Recipes Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Food+and+Recipes+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments:
Ohh perfect time for this thread. 

I prefer sandwiches for my breakfast. I'm just disgusted with the shitty eggless Veeba mayonnaise that comes in the family grocery.

Please share some good mayonnaise brand (egg based, original flavor) and where to get it in online or in Jaipur.

Also ingredients or recipes to experiment something new with grilled cheese sandwich?
reliance fresh keeps a stock of hellmanns mayo - both veg and egg based. not sure about jaipur tho, my anecdote is from hsr, bangalore

It's pricey, but Kewpie mayo in my opinion is superior to all other mayos I've tried so far. It's entirely egg based, and is actually made with only egg yolks, so it has a very creamy taste and texture. I bought a 300ml bottle from Amazon for 340 rupees. If you're open to splurging I highly recommend this.

[Homemade Mayo](https://www.inspiredtaste.net/25943/homemade-mayonnaise-recipe/) is really easy to make, if you’re interested in that. Also you can mix in things with it, eg Sriracha or hot pepper sauces.
